overview: l'Odge d'Oor is a rare and precious necklace of vignettes commenting on religion, society, and humanity's place in Nature. A 'traditionally Surrealistic' tale stretching from the Garden of Eden to the present spinning tales of a nudist camp that argues the Biblical ramifications of eating pork, to the consequences of a deityâ€™s one-night stand to extraterrestrial chicken wings among other stories in this perverse adult comedy. l'Odge d'Oor is a modern juxtaposition of the absurd, the insignificant, the existential and the profound. Could the reason life exists at all be that procreation feels so good?
title: L'ODGE D'OOR
